intro: Facelis plumosa, commonly known as the plumose facelis, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its delicate, feathery leaves that give it its common name. It produces small, white flowers that are often clustered together, adding a subtle beauty to its appearance. Facelis plumosa is typically found in moist, shaded environments within its native habitat.
